brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to prove the superiority of entecavir over lamivudine for
      preventing the risk of hepatitis B virus reactivation in patients with non-Hodgkin lymphoma
      on CHOP/R-CHOP.

clinical_study.brief_title: Entecavir Versus Lamivudine for Preventing the Risk of Hepatitis B Reactivation in NHL

detailed_description.textblock:
In china, previous studies showed patients with non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL) are likely to
      have hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection. The risk of HBV reactivation is high when patients
      were treated with CHOP, especially in combination with rituximab. The aim of this study is
      to compare entecavir with lamivudine, 2 commonly used anti-virus agents, for preventing the
      risk of HBV reactivation in patients with NHL on CHOP/R-CHOP.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Previously untreated NHL suitable for CHOP/R-CHOP treatment

          -  Age range 18-80 years old

          -  HBsAg positive with high level of HBV DNA

          -  Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status 0-2

          -  Life expectancy of more than 3 months

          -  Adequate organ function

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Primary or secondary central nervous system involvement

          -  With hepatitis C virus infection

          -  Previous serious cardiac disease

          -  History of other malignancies except cured basal cell carcinoma of skin and carcinoma
             in-situ of uterine cervix

          -  Pregnant or lactating women

          -  Serious uncontrolled diseases and intercurrent infection

clinical_study.official_title: Entecavir Versus Lamivudine for Preventing the Risk of Hepatitis B Virus Reactivation in Patients With Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma on CHOP/R-CHOP: a Randomized Phase II Study

other_outcome.measure: Incidence of drug resistance of viral variants

primary_outcome.description: Defined by increased level of HBV DNA

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Defined by increased level of alanine transaminase
secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence rate of hepatitis and HBV reactivation-related hepatitis

secondary_outcome.description: Measured by information of treatment delay
secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence rate and median time of treatment delay due to hepatitis

secondary_outcome.description: Measured by information of HBV DNA level normalization
secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence rate and median time of HBV DNA level normalization

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
